meanings.sent1: The equivocalness of his statement left everyone confused.
meanings.sent2: The equivocalness of the instructions made it hard to know what to do.
meanings.sent3: The equivocalness of the joke made it fall flat.
meanings.sent4: Her equivocalness was like a fog that obscured the truth.
meanings.sent5: The equivocalness of the map led them astray.

meanings.definition: The quality of being open to more than one interpretation
meanings.sent1: The equivocalness of the painting allowed viewers to see different things.
meanings.sent2: His equivocalness in his speech made it hard to discern his true intentions.
meanings.sent3: The equivocalness of the riddle made it both frustrating and fun.
meanings.sent4: The equivocalness of her smile hinted at hidden emotions.
meanings.sent5: The equivocalness of the contract made negotiation tricky.

meanings.sent1: The equivocalness of the weather forecast left them unsure whether to bring an umbrella.
meanings.sent2: The equivocalness of the answer only added to the confusion.
meanings.sent3: His equivocalness in decision-making often led to delays.
meanings.sent4: The equivocalness of the melody gave it an ethereal quality.
meanings.sent5: The equivocalness of her response left him hanging.
